question: 希望する
sourceAnswer: To Wish, To Request, To Hope, To Seek
activeAnswer: To Wish, To Request, To Hope, To Seek
sourceMnemonic:
You know that <ja>希望</ja> is a "wish." When you "do a wish," that means <vocabulary>to wish</vocabulary>, <vocabulary>to request</vocabulary> or <vocabulary>to hope</vocabulary>.

This is a formal way to say that you wish for something, so you might use it at work to request an opportunity to work abroad, or let them know politely that you're resigning.
sourceReadingMnemonic: The reading comes from <ja>希望</ja>. It's also the on'yomi jukugo reading as well, if that helps any.
